terminal_illness_benefits.value:
1. **Lump Sum Benefit**: In case of diagnosis of **Terminal Illness**, a lump sum benefit of up to a maximum of **₹2 Crores** shall be paid immediately.  
2. **Accelerated Benefit**: This is a **100% accelerated benefit**, meaning that the amount paid for the Terminal Illness will reduce the **Death Benefit** amount by the same amount.  
3. **Policy Continuation**: Upon diagnosis of Terminal Illness during the policy term, all other **Optional In-built Covers** and their corresponding premiums will cease immediately, and the policy will continue for the remaining **Death Benefit** only, subject to payment of premiums for the base **Death Benefit** as due.  
4. **Diagnosis Confirmation**: The Terminal Illness must be diagnosed and confirmed by **two Medical Practitioners**, who should be specialists in the relevant field of medicine.  
5. **Independent Assessment**: The company reserves the right to conduct an independent assessment by a different Medical Practitioner other than the two provided by the policyholder.  
6. **Impact on Other Covers**: If the **Terminal Illness benefit** is chosen as an **Optional In-built Cover**, upon diagnosis, any **Accidental Total Permanent Disability (ATPD)** coverage on the impacted life will cease.  
7. **Premium Adjustments**: If any **ATPD Optional In-built Cover** is chosen and the **Sum Assured** is increased subsequently due to **Life Stage Cover Enhancement** or other optional covers, the premium applicable for these additional coverages will increase accordingly.

other_benefits.value:
1. **Child Care Benefit (CCB)**: This is an additional benefit that can be opted to safeguard the child’s future. The CCB Sum Assured will be payable when the age of the child is between 0 to 21 years at the time of death of the Life Assured/Working Spouse. This benefit can only be opted with the **Life Secure Plan Option**.

2. **Block Your Premium (BYP) Benefit**: This option allows the policyholder to block their premium at inception and increase cover up to 100% of the Base Sum Assured in the next 5 years. This benefit is available only with the **Life Secure Plan Option**.

3. **Terminal Illness Benefit**: This option is available with the **Life Secure** and **Life Secure with Return of Premium** plan options, allowing for coverage in case of terminal illness.

4. **Steady Income Benefit**: This benefit can be availed on attainment of age 60 years.

5. **Accidental Total & Permanent Disability Benefit**: This includes no future premiums on occurrence of accidental total and permanent disability, and an additional lump sum payment in case of accidental total and permanent disability or accidental death, if opted.

6. **Tax Benefits**: Tax benefits may be applicable under this policy, although specific details are not provided in the document.

1. **Death Benefit Payout Options**: The policyholder can choose one of the following options at the time of buying the policy, which cannot be changed later:
   - **Lump Sum**: Entire benefit is paid out as a one-time lump sum, providing timely financial support to the family.
   - **Monthly Income**: The benefit is paid out in monthly installments.

   - The **Sum Assured** paid under different **Optional In-built Covers** will only be paid as a lump sum.
   - No **Survival/Maturity benefit** is payable on survival of the Life Assured.
   - The categorization of Spouse into **Working** and **Non-Working** will be as per the Company’s BAUP.

surrender_benefits.value:
1. **Surrender Benefit**: The Policyholder shall be returned the **Total Premiums Paid**, excluding underwriting extra premiums and premiums paid for Optional In-Built Covers, upon surrendering the policy under specific conditions.

2. **Conditions for Surrender**: The surrender benefit is available at the earlier of:
   - When the attained age of the Life Assured is **65 years** (age last birthday).
   - The **25th Policy Year** for Policy Terms from **40 years to 44 years** and the **30th Policy Year** for Policy Terms greater than **44 years**.

3. **Single Premium Policies**: For Single Premium policies, the surrender benefit is available from the **first Policy year**.

4. **Limited Pay Policies**: For Limited pay policies, the surrender benefit is available after payment of all premiums due under the policy as per the chosen **Premium Payment Term (PPT)**.

5. **Calculation of Surrender Value**: The surrender value payable for each life, in respect of each benefit (where the same is in-force), shall be calculated separately based on:
   - **Premiums Paid**
   - **Unexpired Term**
   - **Policy Term**

6. **Death Benefit Clause**: In case of death due to suicide within **12 months** from the revival date of the policy, the higher of **80% of the Total Premiums Paid** until the date of death or their respective early exit value/surrender values as on the date of death will be applicable. 

7. **Exclusions**: There are no exclusions other than the **suicide clause** for the Death Benefit.

surrender_value_factor.value: The **Surrender Value** for the iSelect Smart360 Term Plan is the higher of **Guaranteed Surrender Value (GSV)** and **Special Surrender Value (SSV)**, subject to a maximum of 100% of **Total Premiums Paid**. The policy acquires a GSV after payment of at least the first 2 consecutive policy years' premiums. In **Single Premium policies**, the surrender benefit is available from the first policy year, while in **Limited Pay policies**, it is available after payment of all premiums due under the policy as per the chosen **Premium Payment Term (PPT)**. The surrender value payable for each life, in respect of each benefit (where the same is in-force), shall be calculated separately based on premiums paid, unexpired term, and policy term applicable for a given benefit for a given life. Upon payment of the surrender value, all benefits attaching to that life under this policy will cease.

paid_up_value.value: The **Paid-up Benefit** available for this policy includes: 1. **Paid-up Sum Assured on Maturity**: This will be paid in lump sum as Maturity Benefit upon policy termination. 2. **Paid-up ADB Sum Assured**: In case of death, this amount will be paid in addition to the Paid-up Sum Assured. 3. **Paid-up TI Sum Assured**: This will be payable in case of diagnosis of Total and Permanent Disability (TI). 4. **Surrender Value**: The higher of Guaranteed Surrender Value (GSV) and Special Surrender Value will be applicable. 5. **Waiver of Future Premium Benefit**: This will terminate immediately upon the policy moving into Paid-up status if optional in-built covers are opted. 6. **Paid-up Status**: The policy acquires Paid-up status after the first policy year's premium is paid, and if subsequent premiums are not paid within the grace period. 7. **Benefits on Paid-up Status**: The policyholder will receive benefits applicable in the event of death, survival, or maturity corresponding to the Paid-up status. 8. **Optional In-built Covers**: A paid-up benefit shall be payable in case of occurrences covered under these options.

exit_options.value:
1. **Special Exit Value Benefit**: This benefit allows the Policyholder to receive the **Total Premiums Paid**, excluding underwriting extra premiums and premiums for Optional In-Built Covers, upon surrendering the policy at the earlier of:  
   - When the attained age of the Life Assured is **65 years** (age last birthday).  
   - The **25th Policy Year** for Policy Terms from **40 years to 44 years** and the **30th Policy Year** for Policy Terms greater than **44 years**.  
   - The policy will terminate after payment of this benefit.  
   - If any Optional In-Built Covers have been chosen, their Early Exit Value or Surrender Value will be paid, and their coverage will terminate.  

2. **Conditions for Special Exit Value Benefit**:  
   - The policy must be **in-force** at the time of availing this benefit.  
   - Not available for Policy Terms less than **40 years** or where the Maturity Age is more than **85 years**.  
   - Not available on policies with **Spouse coverage**.  
   - Not available if **Block Your Premium (BYP)** Optional In-built Cover has been exercised.  
   - Cannot be availed post occurrence of the contingent event.  

3. **Death Benefit Exclusions**:  
   - The only exclusion for the Death Benefit is the **suicide clause** (if death occurs within **12 months** from the revival date of the policy).  
   - In such cases, the higher of **80% of the Total Premiums Paid** until the date of death or their respective early exit value/surrender values as on the date of death will be paid.  

4. **Free Look Period**:  
   - If the Policyholder does not agree with the terms and conditions of the policy, they can exercise the **Free Look Period** option.

exit_option_conditions.value:
1. **Policy In-Force**: The policy must be in-force at the time of availing the Special Exit Value benefit.
2. **Policy Term Restrictions**: This benefit is not available for policy terms less than 40 years or where the maturity age exceeds 85 years.
3. **Spouse Coverage Exclusion**: The benefit is not available if spouse coverage is applicable under the policy.
4. **Block Your Premium (BYP) Exclusion**: This benefit cannot be availed if the Block Your Premium (BYP) Optional In-built Cover has been exercised.
5. **Contingent Event Condition**: The benefit cannot be availed post occurrence of the contingent event applicable under Optional In-Built Covers where future premiums have been waived-off.
6. **Policy Termination**: The policy will terminate after payment of this benefit. If any Optional In-Built Covers have been chosen, their Early Exit Value or Surrender Value (as applicable) will be paid, and their coverage will terminate.
7. **No Special Exit Value**: No Special Exit Value is available under the Life Secure Option, Life Secure with Income, or Life Secure with Return of Premium options.
